results.title: The Van
results.creator_credit: Stephen Frears, Lynda Myles, Deadly Films and BBC
results.brief_description: Set during the 1989 World Cup season when Ireland’s national identity is intricately wrapped up in its sporting success, “The Van” follows the relationship of lifelong friends, Brendan (Bimbo) and Larry. Larry, long time unemployed and living on welfare, finds his professional friend Bimbo joining the ranks of the unemployed when he is retrenched. With the help of a dodgy associate, Bimbo purchases a dilapidated van and miraculously cleans it up to create the modest business enterprise of Bimbo’s Burgers. He asks his best mate Larry to work for him, and soon Larry’s daughter Diane and vegetarian son Kevin begin work with them to cater for the soccer, beach and concert crowds. As the pressure of working long hours, meeting stringent health regulations and Bimbo’s dismay at Larry’s work ethic weighs on them, Larry and Bimbo push the boundaries of their relationship, forcing them to choose between being partners and being friends. With a soundtrack by Eric Clapton, “The Van” is the final chapter in Roddy Doyle’s Barrytown trilogy. Cast includes Colm Meaney, Donal O’Kelly, Neili Conroy and Ger Ryan.

results.title: Felicia's journey
results.creator_credit: Atom Egoyan, Bruce Davey, Screenventures, Alliance Atlantis and Marquis Films
results.brief_description: Atom Egoyan’s second literary adaptation (“The Sweet Hereafter” was the first) is a dark yet comic tale of the powerful influence of childhood and the search for contentment in life’s journey. Pregnant and alone, Felicia (Elaine Cassidy) leaves her native home of Ireland in search of Johnny, father of her unborn child. Arriving in Birmingham with few clues as to his location, she meets factory canteen manager Mr Hilditch (Bob Hoskins), a seemingly benevolent gent who offers to help Felicia find lodgings and her love. Hilditchs’ home is a time capsule of 1950’s homewear, and he spends his evenings watching footage of his mother, Gala (Arsinee Khanjian), a successful television chef, and himself as a young child in the background. The relationship revealed throughout the footage is deliciously tinged with antagonism and pain, something that remains with Hilditch throughout his adult life and appears to have influenced his relationship with women. Felicia is not the first wayward soul assisted by Mr Hilditch, as it is revealed he has recorded the innermost thoughts of numerous other women he has picked up in his car - Felicia appears to be the next in line. Cast also includes Peter McDonald, Gerard McSorley and Claire Benedict. Based on the novel by William Trevor.

results.title: Shampoo
results.creator_credit: Hal Ashby, Warren Beatty and Vista Company
results.brief_description: A frankly adult comedy about the sex lives of the rich and aimless, “Shampoo” is also a pointed commentary on the demise of the 60s idealism at the dawn of the Nixon era. It is election day, 1968, and Beverly Hills hairdresser George Roundy is too worried about attending to all of his womens’ tonsorial and sexual needs and trying to swing a bank loan to fund his own salon to notice the fateful Presidential race. As George juggles the demands of girlfriend Jill and mistress Felicia, not to mention Felicia’s daughter, he meets Felicia’s husband - Lester, to get money for the salon and discovers that his beloved ex-girlfriend, Jackie is now Lester’s mistress. Lester asks George to escort Jackie to a banquet for Nixon supporters, leading to a series of climactic confrontations at the dinner and a Hollywood orgy that exposes the conflicting demands of sex, love and security among these terminally narcissistic L.A. denizens. Cast includes: Warren Beatty, Julie Christie, Goldie Hawn, Lee Grant, Jack Warden and Carrie Fisher.

results.title: The Long walk of Nelson Mandela
results.creator_credit: Clifford Bestall, Indra de Langerolle, David Fanning, Unapix Entertainment Productions, LLC and Story Street Productions
results.brief_description: This is an intimate portrait of one of the century’s greatest leaders told by those who have known and shared the more important moments of his life. However it is not just a narrative of Mandela’s life, its purpose is to examine how Mandela has risen above his very public personal trials and kept his eye unflinchingly on a distant and noble goal. Mandela’s life story and achievements are told through interviews with his contemporaries and friends and the use of archival footage.

results.title: Life is beautiful = La vita e bella
results.creator_credit: Roberto Benigni, Gianluigi Braschi, Elda Ferri and Melampo Cinematografica
results.brief_description: In this World War II tragicomedy, writer/director Roberto Benigni portrays Guido, who moves during the 30s from the country to a Tuscan town, where he falls in love with schoolteacher Dora. Dora likes Guido, but she remains faithful to her pompous fiancee, causing Guido to come up with inventive ways of wooing her. Meanwhile, anti-semitic attitudes lead to attacks against Jewish members of the community, including Guido’s uncle. Leaping ahead five years, during World War II, Guido and Dora are married with a son Giosue. After they are imprisoned in a concentration camp, Guido goes to elaborate lengths to keep his son from understanding the truth of their situation. In Italian with English subtitles. Cast includes: Roberto Benigni, Nicoletta Braschi, Giustino Durano and Giorgio Cantarini.

results.title: Dear diary = Caro diario
results.creator_credit: Nanni Moretti, Nella Banfi, Studio Canal, La Sept Cinema, Banfilm and Sacher Film
results.brief_description: Moretti’s intimate and hilarious film diary, which follows the idiosyncratic Italian director’s personal experiences over 18 months, was received rapturously at Cannes where it won the Best Director Award. The film is divided into three chapters: in the first, we follow Moretti on his Vespa through the streets of Rome; in the second, he escapes with a friend to the beautiful Eolian islands; and in the third we see his dealings with conventional and alternative doctors. In Italian with English subtitles.

results.title: Daleks: invasion Earth 2150 A.D. [Widescreen]
results.brief_description: Based on a story from the BBC TV serial “Doctor Who”, Dr. Who and his companions arrive on Earth in the year 2150 AD, only to discover that the planet has been invaded and its population enslaved by the dreaded Daleks. The time travellers assist human resistance groups to foil the Daleks’ plan to mine the Earth’s core.

results.title: The Bird with the crystal plumage = L'Uccello dalle piume di cristallo
results.creator_credit: Dario Argento, Salvatore Argento, CCC Filmkunst, Speda Spettacoli and Glazier
results.brief_description: An American writer (Tony Musante) working in Italy witnesses an attempted murder when passing an art gallery one night. The attacker escapes making the writer the key witness and potentially, the next victim. Loosely based on a novel by Brian Edgar Wallace, Argento’s first feature helped established the Italian filmmakers reputation as the master of the Gaillo genre (Giallo meaning yellow, the colour of the cheap and lurid horror/thriller paperback novels sold in Italy). ‘The bird with the crystal plumage’s‘ stylish and violent set pieces (enhanced by Vitorrio Storaro’s fluid cinematography and Ennio Morricone’s unnerving score) had Argento dubbed in his home country as the Italian Hitchcock. The comparisons don’t end there however, as both directors also share a taste for sly black humour which Argento displays through the array of oddball characters that populate the film, including a demented artist who eats cats and a pimp with a neurotic streak. Cast also includes Suzy Kendall, Enrico Maria Salerno, Eva Renzi, Reggie Nalder and Mario Adorf. See also ‘Deep red’ (1975), ‘Suspiria’ (1977) and ‘Trauma’ (1993).

results.title: Nostalgia = Nostalghia
results.creator_credit: Andrei Tarkovsky, Francesco Casati, Sovin Film, Radiotelevisione Italiana and Opera Film Produzione
results.brief_description: This is Tarkovsky’s haunting first film made outside of Russia. The story explores the melancholy of the expatriate through the eyes of the film’s protagonist, Gorchakov, a Russian poet researching in Italy. Arriving at a Tuscan village spa with Eugenia, his beautiful Italian interpreter, Gorchakov is visited by memories of Russia and of his wife and children, and encounters the local mystic, who sets him a challenging task. The film is filled with mysterious and extraordinary images, culminating in the final scene where all the film’s images coalesce into a miraculous whole. As in all Tarkovsky films, nature and the elements of fire and water, music, painting and poetry, and the contrast of black and white and colour photography, all play a major role. In Italian with English subtitles.

results.title: Last stand at Saber River
results.creator_credit: Dick Lowry, Steven Brandman, Thomas Kane, Mary Ann Braubach, Turner Entertainment and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: An embittered Confederate soldier returns to his Arizona homestead after the end of the Civil War, only to find it occupied by pioneers sympathetic to the Union war effort. Desperate to rebuild the life he once knew, he is forced to re-consider his loyalties and join forces with his Union adversary to make a last stand for the one thing left worth fighting for - his family.
